Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially light-brown in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip, one line of cord-marked decoration around the shoulder and faint traces of one line of red-painted Coptic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394864) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394864)
